The claim for relief under the Atal Bee:
The scheme named as "Atal Beemit Vyakti Kalyan Yojana" is a welfare measure for employees covered under Section 2(9), in the form of cash compensation up to 90 days, once in a lifetime,to be claimed after 3 months in one or more spells for being rendered unemployed; provided the employee should have completed 2 years of insurable employment and has contributed not less than 78 days in each of the 4 consecutive contribution periods immediately preceding to the claim of the relief. The relief shall not exceed 25% of the average earning per day.
 The ESICorporation in its 175th meeting on 18.09.2018 decided to provide Relief to the Insured Person (IP) who has been rendered unemployed subject to the exclusions in the form of cash compensation .
 Duration of allowance
 The maximum duration, for which an IP shall be eligible to draw the Relief under the Atal Beemit Vyakti Kalyan Yojana (ABVKY) will be 90 days once in life time after a minimum of two years of Insurable Employment and subject to the contributory conditions specified above.
 The claim for relief under the Atal Beemit Kalyaan Yojana will be payable after the three months of his/her clear unemployment.
 The relief will be paid for clear month of unemployment. No prospective claim will be allowed.
 In case the beneficiary gets gainful employment in between the three months of unemployment for which he was eligible for relief under ABVKY, the relief will be payable for clear month of unemployment between the date of unemployment and date of re-employment. The balance of 90 days of relief in this case may be claimed in the same manner as mentioned above based upon the initial contributory conditions by the beneficiary in case he again renders unemployed from Insurable employment within one year from initial unemployment.
 Eligibility
 Employees who are covered under Section 2(9) of the ESI Act 1948.
 The Insured Person (IP) should have been rendered unemployed during the period the relief is claimed.
 Applicant should have been in insurable employment for a minimum period of two years.
 He/She should have contributed not less than 78 days during each of the preceding four contribution periods.
 Aadhar and Bank Account of the Insured Person should be linked with insured person database
 The contribution in respect of him should have been paid or payable by the employer.
 The contingency of the unemployment should not have been as a result of any punishment for misconduct or superannuation or voluntary retirement.
 ABVKY Relief will not be applicable under following circumstances:
 If the employees declared illegal Strike resorted to by the competent authority.
 If contributory service is less than 2 years
 During lock out.
 On attaining the age of superannuation.
 On being re-employed elsewhere during the period he/she is in receipt of Relief under ABVKY.
 Dismissal/termination under disciplinary action.
 Voluntary abandonment of employment/ voluntary retirement/ premature retirement.
 Convicted (i.e. punished for false statement) under the provisions of Section 84 of the ESI Act read with Rule 62 of the ESI (Central) Rule
 On death of beneficiary
 How to apply for claim for relief
 1.The claimant can apply for relief claim anytime after being rendered unemployed, but not later than 1 year from the date of unemployment to the appropriate Branch Office in the form of affidavit in the prescribed Form (AB-1)
 2.The applicant have to submit his claim to his designated Branch office.
 3.On the ESIC Portal a link for generating claim for Atal Bimit Kalyan Yojana will be given.
 4.The Insured Person will have to enter his
 insurance number,
 Aadhar Number,
 Bank Account Number,
 the period of claim.
 Bank Account Details
 Mobile Number
 5.
 The system will check his eligibility: -
 if he is eligible it will generate claim Form AB-1 along with a forwarding letter from his last employer in Form AB-2 and instruction for the IP
 If he is not eligible, a regret message of his ineligibility will be sent.
 6.The eligible Insured person will take the printout of the claim submitted above and letter generated by the system to the employer and submit the duly signed claim in affidavit along with required forwarding by the employer to his designated ESIC Branch Office. Each claim thus generated will have an auto generated unique ID number.
 7.On claim receipt the details as mentioned by the applicant IP will be checked in the system by the staff at the Branch Office under supervision of the Branch Manager. Then, the system will calculate the claimant's eligibility for relief under the scheme and its quantum for which the claimant is entitled based upon the details provided by the IP as well as the contribution and other details available in the system.
 8.The payment of the relief will be made to the IP's bank account.
 Payment Mode
 The Relief under ABVKY will be paid by Branch Office to IP directly in his bank account electronically only.
 In the event of death of IP, the amount of Relief under ABVKY shall be paid/ payable to his/her nominee/legal heir by the account payee cheque only.
 The claimant's bank account details in the ESIC Database is a pre-condition for claiming this relief,
 In case the bank account details of the claimant are not available in the ESIC Database or the IP has changed his bank account then the same may be authenticated by the Branch Manager on the basis of the canceled cheque leaf or the passbook of the bank account having name of the claimant on it, which the claimant will provide along with the claim for this relief.
 The claim shall be processed on AB-3.

Providing insurance coverage to farmers:
Introduction
 Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana is an insurance service for farmers that was lainched by Prime Minister Narendra Modi on 18 February 2016. The scheme was formulated in line with One Nation–One Scheme theme by replacing earlier two schemes National Agricultural Insurance Scheme (NAIS) and Modified National Agricultural Insurance Scheme (MNAIS) by incorporating their best features and removing their inherent drawbacks (shortcomings).
 The aim of the scheme is to reduce the premium burden on farmers and ensure early settlement of crop assurance claim for the full insured sum.
 Objectives of PMFBY
 Providing insurance coverage to farmers and giving them financial support in the event of failure of any of the notified crop as a result of natural calamities, pests and diseases.
 To stabilise their income for ensuring their continuance in farming.
 For encouraging armers to adopt innovative and modern practices of agriculture.
 To ensure flow of credit to the agriculture sector.
 Agency of implementation
 PMFBY is implemented through a multi-agency framework by selected insurance companies under the overall guidance and control of
 Department of Agriculture, Cooperation and Farmers Welfare (DAC&FW)
 Ministry Of Agriculture And Farmers Welfare (MoA&FW)
 Government of India
 Commercial Banks
 Co-operative Banks
 Regional Rural Banks and their regulatory bodies
 Government Departments such as:
 	Agriculture
 Co-operation
 Horticulture
 Statistics
 Revenue
 Information/Science and Technology
 Panchayati Raj
 
 Coverage of Risks under PMFBY
 Comprehensive risk insurance is provided to cover yield losses due to non-preventable risks, such as :
 	Natural Fire and Lightning,
 Storm, Hailstorm,
 Cyclone, Typhoon,
 Tempest, Hurricane,
 Tornado.
 Risks due to Flood,
 Inundation and Landslide,
 Drought, Dry spells,
 Pests/ Diseases also will be covered
 
 In post-harvest losses, coverage will be available up to a maximum period of 14 days from harvesting for those crops which are kept in "cut & spread" condition to dry in the field.
 Areas where farmers are prevented from sowing/planting the insured crop due to adverse weather conditions, shall be eligible for indemnity claims upto a maximum of 25 per cent of the sum-insured.
 Risks and Losses not to be covered under PMFBY
 War & kindred perils,
 malicious damage,
 nuclear risks,
 riots,
 theft, act of enmity,
 grazed and/or destroyed by domestic and/or wild animals,
 In case of Post–Harvest losses the harvested crop bundled and heaped at a place before threshing, other preventable risks.
 Eligibility Criteria :
 All farmers growing notified crops in a notified area during the season who have insurable interest in the crop are eligible.
 Compulsory Coverage : Farmers in the notified area who possess a Crop Loan account/KCC account(called as Loanee Farmers) to whom credit limit is sanctioned/renewed for the notified crop during the crop season.
 Voluntary Coverage : It may be obtained by all farmers not covered in Compulsory Coverage, including Crop KCC/Crop Loan Account holders whose credit limit is not renewed.
 How to apply :
 To apply for crop insurance, farmers can visit the website pmfby.gov.in

किसी भी उम्र के विकलांग व्यक्ति जो उत्त:
कृत्रिम अंग / सहायक उपकरण योजना उत्तर प्रदेश सरकार द्वारा शुरू की गई योजना है जिसका उद्देश्य विकलांग व्यक्तियों को वित्तीय अनुदान प्रदान करना है (जिनकी वार्षिक आय तय बीपीएल सीमा से अधिक नहीं है, अर्थात ग्रामीण क्षेत्रों के लिए 46,080/- रूपये और शहरी क्षेत्रों के लिए 56,460/- रूपये और यह आय पात्र वार्षिक आधार पर या कृत्रिम अंगों और सहायता उपकरणों आदि की खरीद के लिए उत्तर प्रदेश सरकार द्वारा किए गए संशोधनों के अनुसार है ।
 अनुदान की दर
 इस योजना के तहत, विकलांग व्यक्तियों के लिए कृत्रिम अंगों और सहायता उपकरणों की खरीद के लिए, वित्तीय अनुदान की अधिकतम राशि 8000 / - रुपये या उत्तर प्रदेश सरकार द्वारा तय या संशोधित के अनुसार अनुदान होगी।
 पात्रता
 किसी भी उम्र के विकलांग व्यक्ति जो उत्तर प्रदेश का निवासी होना चाहिए।
 विकलांगता से पीड़ित व्यक्ति, जिसकी न्यूनतम विकलांगता 40% है और इसे प्राधिकृत प्राधिकारी राज्य सरकार द्वारा प्रमाणित किया जाना चाहिए। मानसिक मंदता की स्थिति में, चित की अवरुद्ध या अपूर्ण विकास की अवस्था, जो विशेष रूप से वृद्धि की असामान्यताओं की विशेषता है, जिसे प्राधिकृत अधिकारी द्वारा प्रमाणित किया गया हो।
 चिकित्सा अधिकारी द्वारा विकलांग व्यक्ति के लिए आवश्यक कृत्रिम अंगों / सहायक उपकरण के लिए अनुशंसित।
 	ऐसे व्यक्ति जिनके पास भारत सरकार / राज्य सरकार / स्थानीय निकायों द्वारा पिछले 3 वर्षों में उपकरणों के लिए कोई लाभ नहीं है। हालांकि, किसी भी शैक्षणिक संस्थान के नियमित छात्रों के लिए यह सीमा एक वर्ष के लिए होगी।
 उपकरण का विवरण
 इस योजना के तहत, विकलांगता के अनुसार, कृत्रिम अंग / सहायता उपकरण विकलांग व्यक्तियों को प्रदान किए जाएंगे: -
 गतिशीलता सहायता उपकरण जैसे: -
 	ट्राइसाइकिल,
 व्हीलचेयर,
 सी.पी. चेयर,
 क्रैचेस,
 वॉकिंग स्टीक
 और वॉकिंग फ्रेम / रोलेटर्स।
 
 जो छात्र दृष्टिबाधित हैं, उन्हें गणितीय फ्रेम, एबेकस, ज्यामिति किट और ब्रेल शैक्षिक किट जैसे शैक्षिक उपकरण प्रदान किए जाएंगे।
 दृष्टिहीन व्यक्तियों के लिए ब्लाइंड स्टिक।
 श्रवण बाधित व्यक्तियों के लिए, विभिन्न प्रकार के श्रवण-यंत्र और शिक्षा किट।
 M.S.I.D. मानसिक विकलांग बच्चों और छात्रों के लिए किट (मल्टी-सेंसरी एजुकेशन डेवलपमेंट किट)।
 कुष्ठ रोग से पीड़ित लोगों को दैनिक गतिविधि किट (A.D.L. किट)।
 बहु-विकलांगता या विकलांग व्यक्तियों के मामले में जिन्हें एक से अधिक सहायता / सहायता उपकरण की आवश्यकता होती है, उन्हें अधिकतम 8000 / - रुपये का वित्तीय अनुदान प्रदान किया जाएगा।
 अनुदान और प्रतिबंधों की प्रक्रिया
 निर्धारित आवेदन-पत्र जिला पीडब्ल्यूडी सशक्तिकरण अधिकारी, कार्यालय को प्रस्तुत करने के लिए प्रस्तुत करना होगा।
 	जिला पीडब्ल्यूडी सशक्तिकरण अधिकारी प्राप्त आवेदनों को श्रेणीबद्ध करके 'पहले आओ और पहले पाओ के आधार' पर उपलब्ध राशि के अनुसार आवेदकों को वित्तीय अनुदान की स्वीकृति प्रदान करेगा।
 योजना के तहत, यदि कोई आवेदन रद्द किया जाता है, तो ऐसे आवेदकों की सूची को रद्द करने के स्पष्ट कारण के साथ सुरक्षित रखा जाएगा।
 इस मैनुअल के प्रभावी कार्यान्वयन के लिए, निदेशक, पीडब्ल्यूडी सशक्तिकरण विभाग द्वारा महत्वपूर्ण दिशा-निर्देश जारी किए जाएंगे।
 योजना के तहत, किसी भी विवादास्पद विषय पर सरकार का निर्णय अंतिम होगा और सभी पर लागू होगा।
 आवेदन कैसे करें
 विकलांग व्यक्ति, जन सुविधा केंद्र / लोकवाणी और सार्वजनिक जिला पीडब्ल्यूडी सशक्तिकरण अधिकारी कार्यालय के माध्यम से आवेदन कर सकते हैं और ई-आवेदन की अद्यतन स्थिति प्राप्त कर सकते हैं।
 प्रमाण पत्र के लिए संपर्क करें
 अनुदान प्राप्त करने के लिए, माननीय सांसद, माननीय विधायक, महापौर, पार्षद, नगर पंचायत अध्यक्ष, जिला पंचायत अध्यक्ष, जिला के प्रथम श्रेणी मजिस्ट्रेट, तहसीलदार, बीडीओ और ग्राम प्रधान द्वारा जारी आय प्रमाण पत्र पात्र होंगे।
 उपकरण वितरण की प्रक्रिया
 प्रथम आओ प्रथम पाओ के आधार पर जिलों के शिविर के माध्यम से लाभार्थियों को सहायता उपकरण वितरित किए जाएंगे।

Overview Of The Scheme
 
 Name Of The Scheme
 Janani Suraksha Yojana (JSY).
 Launched Date
 12th of April 2005.
 Scheme Type
 Safe Motherhood Programme.
 Objective
 
 Reducing Maternal/Child Mortality Rate
 Promote Child Birth Deliveries In Government Health Care Institutions
 To Provide Good Medical Care During Pregnancy, At the Time Of Delivery and After Delivery Period.
 
 Nodal Ministry
 National Health Mission, Under The Ministry Of Health & Family Welfare.
 Eligibility
 All Pregnant Women Are Eligible Who Are Ready To Deliver Their Child In Government Health Care Centres or Government Accredited Private Health Care Institutions.
 Introduction
 Janani Suraksha Yojana is a cash assistance scheme of National Health Mission under the Ministry Of Health & Family Welfare.
 It was launched on 12th Of April 2005.
 It is a scheme for a pregnant women to assist them financially to cover the the delivery expenses occurred at the time of delivery and for the post delivery care of mother and her child.
 It is a 100% Centrally sponsored scheme.
 This scheme is specially focuses on poor pregnant women for safe motherhood and to provide them a good quality Pre as well as Post delivery care services.
 It aims to promote institutional deliveries to reduce maternal/child mortality.
 It specially focuses on Low Performing States (LPS).
 
 Low Performing State(LPS) and High Performing State(HPS)
 
 Low Performing State(LPS)
 Low Performing States are those States which have less than 25% of institutional deliveries i.e. child was born at home instead of government hospitals/Primary or Community Health Centre.
 			Such States Are:-
 			Uttar Pradesh
 Uttarakhand
 Bihar
 Jharkhand
 Madhya Pradesh
 Chhattisgarh
 Assam
 Rajasthan
 Orissa
 Jammu and Kashmir.
 
 High Performing State(HPS)
 High Performing States are those States which have more than 25% institutional deliveries i.e. child was born in the Government Hospital/Primary or Community Heath Centre instead of at Home.
 			Every remaining State/Union Territory which is not in the list of Low Performing State are High Performing State
 
 Eligibility For Cash Assistance
 
 To avail the benefit of cash assistance under Janani Suraksha Yojana following are the eligibility conditions mentioned below:-
 
 Low Performing State
 All pregnant women delivering their child in:-
 			Government Health Centres
 Government Sub Centres(SCs).
 Primary Health Care Centres(PHCs)
 Community Health Centres(CHCs).
 First Referral Units(FRUs).
 General Wards Of District Hospital.
 General Wards Of State Hospitals.
 Accredited Private Institutions, are eligible to get cash assistance under Janani Suraksha Yojana.
 
 High Performing States
 All Below Poverty Line (BPL)/ Schedule Caste/Schedule Tribe(SC/ST) women delivering their child in:-
 			Government Health Centres
 Government Sub Centres(SCs).
 Primary Health Care Centres(PHCs)
 Community Health Centres(CHCs).
 First Referral Units(FRUs).
 General Wards Of District Hospital.
 General Wards Of State Hospitals, are eligible to get cash assistance under Janani Suraksha Yojana.
 
 Low Performing States & High Performing States
 Women belongs to Below Poverty Line, Schedule Caste and Schedule Tribe(SC/ST),delivering their child in accredited private health care institutions.

 Benefits
 Cash Assistance to pregnant women in rural areas of Rs. 1400/- in Low Performing State and Rs. 700/- in High Performing State.
 Cash Assistance to pregnant women in urban areas of Rs. 1000/- in Low Performing State and Rs. 600/- in High Performing State.
 Rs. 500/- cash assistance to pregnant women belongs to Below Poverty Line (BPL) who chooses to deliver her child at home.
 Cash Assistance To ASHA Workers, Of Rs. 600/- in rural area and Rs. 400/- in urban area.
 There is no bar on age and number of child birth by a women in Low Performing State.
 Women can avail the benefit for 2 child births in High Performing State.
 Minimum 3 free Antenatal Checkups before delivery.
 Each beneficiary get Janani Suraksha Card with a Mother Child Health Card.
 Beneficiary get her entitled money at the health centre on arrival and registration for delivery.
 Cash Assistance For Delivery Of Child At Home
 Cash assistance of Rs. 500/- for the pregnant women who choose to deliver their child at home.
 Women should be belongs to Below Poverty Line (BPL).
 Age should be 19 years and above.
 Cash assistance only for 2 births at home.
 Disbursement should be done at the time of delivery or 7 days before the delivery.
 The objective is that the beneficiary would be able to use the cash assistance for her care during delivery and able to bear the cost/ expenses of the delivery.
 Disbursement should be done by ANM/ASHA/ any other link worker.
 Below Poverty Line (BPL) certificate is mandatorily required to avail the benefit.
 Role Of ASHA Workers
 Locate the pregnant women in her area and registered her for Antenatal Care (ANC).
 Help the pregnant women to acquiring mandatory certificates.
 Arrange at least three Antenatal checkups for pregnant women includes the TT (Tetanus Toxoid) injection and IFA (Iron Folic Acid) Tablets.
 Pre locate the functional Government Health Centre or an accredited private health institution for referral and delivery of pregnant women.
 Counsel the pregnant women and get her ready for giving birth of her child for an institutional delivery.
 To be with the pregnant women at the time of the delivery at health centre, till the women is discharged.
 Arrange all the immunization for the newborn child till he/she attain the age of 14 weeks.
 Inform the Auxiliary Nurse Midwife (ANM)/ Medica Officer (MO) about the birth or death of a child or mother.
 Visit the mother to track her health after 7 days of delivery.
 Counsel the mother to initiate breast feeding to the newborn within one hour of delivery and to continue till he/she attain the age of 3 - 6 month
 Spread awareness about the family planning.
 Package For ASHA Worker
 Total assistance of Rs. 600/- in Low Performing States.
 	Rs. 300/- for Antenatal Care Component
 Rs. 300/- for facilitating institutional delivery.
 
 Total assistance of Rs. 400/- in High Performing State.
 	Rs. 200/- for Antenatal Care Component
 Rs. 200/- for facilitating institutional delivery.
 
 Cash assistance of not less than Rs. 250 for ref err el transport, to go to the nearest centre for delivery.
 Cash incentive of minimum Rs. 200/- per delivery for her work relating to facilitating the institutional delivery.
 Amount of Incentive ASHA get only after her post delivery visit to the beneficiary and the child has been immunized for BCG (Bacille Calmette-Guerin).
 To meet the cost of boarding and lodging, ASHA is to be paid a transactional cost for her stay with the pregnant women.
 ASHA get her First payment for the transactional cost at the health centre on reaching the institution with the pregnant women.
 The second payment should be paid after she has made postnatal visit and the child has been immunized for BCG (Bacille Calmette-Guerin).
 All payment to ASHA would be done by the ANM only.
 It is mandatory that ASHA gets her second payment within the 7 days of the delivery.
 No cash package for ASHA worker if pregnant women chose to deliver her child in accredited private health care institutions.
 Special Provisions For Low Performing States
 No Age restriction.
 No restriction up to 2 births.
 Irrespective of birth order, the benefits of the scheme are extended to all pregnant women in Low Performing State.
 No marriage or BPL (Below Poverty Line) certification required for delivering the child in government or accredited health institution.
 Compensation money will be provided under the government family welfare scheme to mother or her husband, if on their own will, they undergoes sterilization, immediately after the delivery of the child.
 Two private institutions per block on their own will should provided delivery services.
 Beneficiaries deliver their child in these accredited private health care institutions would get the cash benefits admissible under the Janani Suraksha Yojana.
 It is very difficult to access PHC/CHCs for maternal care or delivery for women living in tribal and hilly districts.
 Instead of home a well equipped sub center is a better option for normal delivery.
 State/District authority accredited sub centres will be considered as institutional delivery centres.
 Women delivering their child in these centres would be eligible for all cash assistance under Janani Suraksha Yojana.
 Key Features Of The Scheme
 Janani Suraksha Yojana specially focuses on the poor pregnant women for States having low institutional delivery rates.
 Each beneficiary registered under this yojana get a Janani Suraksha Yojana Card and Mother Child Protection Card.
 All the pregnant women in Low Performing States are eligible to get the benefit of cash assistance under the Janani Suraksha yojana.
 Whereas in High Performing States only pregnant women belonging to Below Poverty Line, Schedule Caste and Schedule Tribe, aged 19 and above are eligible.
 In High Performing States Below Poverty Line Certificate (BPL) certificate is mandatorily required to avail the benefit.
 If there is no BPL card or have not issued or have not been updated, in that particular cases, Gram Pradhan or Ward Member of that area certify the poor and needy status of pregnant women.
 If a women chooses to deliver her child in accredited private health institutions, it is mandatory to produce a proper BPL or SC/ST certificate to avail the benefit.
 Beneficiary should also carry a referral slip from the ASHA/ANM/MO and the Mother Child Health/ Janani Suraksha Yojana Card.
 Government is not responsible the cost of delivery in accredited private institutions. Beneficiary has to bear the cost and she only get her entitled cash mentioned in the Janani Suraksha Yojana.
 Cash payment is only paid to mother by ANM/ASHA/ Link worker channel at accredited institution.
 No amount of assistance is given to other person or the relative of the pregnant women.
 If there is any complications occur at the time of delivery at accredited institutions, they are fully responsible for any postnatal complication arising out of the cases handled by them. They should not deny their service.
 In case ASHA did not able to organize a transport for the pregnant women to go to the health institution, the amount of transport assistance money in the ASHA's package goes to the pregnant women at the institution, immediately on arrival and registration for delivery.
 Miscellaneous Features
 State/District Authorities would give advance of Rs. 5000/- and Rs. 10,000/- to each ANM in High Performing State and Low Performing State respectively from the Janani Suraksha Yojana Fund.
 The amount of money should be kept in joint account of ANM and Gram Pradhan.
 ANM have full authority to withdraw cash as and when required.
 In case of any complication or a Caesarean Section is needed for delivery, then the assistance up to Rs. 1500/- per delivery is available for hiring specialist from the private sector.
 Janani Suraksha Yojana is not a cash distributing scheme, it is a scheme to provide quality maternity services to the pregnant women.
 If ASHA worker neither organize any Antenatal Care for pregnant women nor she assist her to the health care centre, in that case ASHA worker will not receive any compensation package.

 Rs. 1000/-
 Benefits
 Cash Assistance to pregnant women in rural areas of Rs. 1400/- in Low Performing State and Rs. 700/- in High Performing State.
 Cash Assistance to pregnant women in urban areas of Rs. 1000/- in Low Performing State and Rs. 600/- in High Performing State.
 Rs. 500/- cash assistance to pregnant women belongs to Below Poverty Line (BPL) who chooses to deliver her child at home.
 Cash Assistance To ASHA Workers, Of Rs. 600/- in rural area and Rs. 400/- in urban area.
 There is no bar on age and number of child birth by a women in Low Performing State.
 Women can avail the benefit for 2 child births in High Performing State.
 Minimum 3 free Antenatal Checkups before delivery.
 Each beneficiary get Janani Suraksha Card with a Mother Child Health Card.
 Beneficiary get her entitled money at the health centre on arrival and registration for delivery.
 Cash Assistance For Delivery Of Child At Home
 Cash assistance of Rs. 500/- for the pregnant women who choose to deliver their child at home.
 Women should be belongs to Below Poverty Line (BPL).
 Age should be 19 years and above.
 Cash assistance only for 2 births at home.
 Disbursement should be done at the time of delivery or 7 days before the delivery.
 The objective is that the beneficiary would be able to use the cash assistance for her care during delivery and able to bear the cost/ expenses of the delivery.
 Disbursement should be done by ANM/ASHA/ any other link worker.
 Below Poverty Line (BPL) certificate is mandatorily required to avail the benefit.
 Role Of ASHA Workers
 Locate the pregnant women in her area and registered her for Antenatal Care (ANC).
 Help the pregnant women to acquiring mandatory certificates.
 Arrange at least three Antenatal checkups for pregnant women includes the TT (Tetanus Toxoid) injection and IFA (Iron Folic Acid) Tablets.
 Pre locate the functional Government Health Centre or an accredited private health institution for referral and delivery of pregnant women.
 Counsel the pregnant women and get her ready for giving birth of her child for an institutional delivery.
 To be with the pregnant women at the time of the delivery at health centre, till the women is discharged.
 Arrange all the immunization for the newborn child till he/she attain the age of 14 weeks.
 Inform the Auxiliary Nurse Midwife (ANM)/ Medica Officer (MO) about the birth or death of a child or mother.
 Visit the mother to track her health after 7 days of delivery.
 Counsel the mother to initiate breast feeding to the newborn within one hour of delivery and to continue till he/she attain the age of 3 - 6 month
 Spread awareness about the family planning.
 Package For ASHA Worker
 Total assistance of Rs. 600/- in Low Performing States.
 	Rs. 300/- for Antenatal Care Component
 Rs. 300/- for facilitating institutional delivery.
 
 Total assistance of Rs. 400/- in High Performing State.
 	Rs. 200/- for Antenatal Care Component
 Rs. 200/- for facilitating institutional delivery.
 
 Cash assistance of not less than Rs. 250 for ref err el transport, to go to the nearest centre for delivery.
 Cash incentive of minimum Rs. 200/- per delivery for her work relating to facilitating the institutional delivery.
 Amount of Incentive ASHA get only after her post delivery visit to the beneficiary and the child has been immunized for BCG (Bacille Calmette-Guerin).
 To meet the cost of boarding and lodging, ASHA is to be paid a transactional cost for her stay with the pregnant women.
 ASHA get her First payment for the transactional cost at the health centre on reaching the institution with the pregnant women.
 The second payment should be paid after she has made postnatal visit and the child has been immunized for BCG (Bacille Calmette-Guerin).
 All payment to ASHA would be done by the ANM only.
 It is mandatory that ASHA gets her second payment within the 7 days of the delivery.
 No cash package for ASHA worker if pregnant women chose to deliver her child in accredited private health care institutions.
 Special Provisions For Low Performing States
 No Age restriction.
 No restriction up to 2 births.
 Irrespective of birth order, the benefits of the scheme are extended to all pregnant women in Low Performing State.
 No marriage or BPL (Below Poverty Line) certification required for delivering the child in government or accredited health institution.
 Compensation money will be provided under the government family welfare scheme to mother or her husband, if on their own will, they undergoes sterilization, immediately after the delivery of the child.
 Two private institutions per block on their own will should provided delivery services.
 Beneficiaries deliver their child in these accredited private health care institutions would get the cash benefits admissible under the Janani Suraksha Yojana.
 It is very difficult to access PHC/CHCs for maternal care or delivery for women living in tribal and hilly districts.
 Instead of home a well equipped sub center is a better option for normal delivery.
 State/District authority accredited sub centres will be considered as institutional delivery centres.
 Women delivering their child in these centres would be eligible for all cash assistance under Janani Suraksha Yojana.
 Key Features Of The Scheme
 Janani Suraksha Yojana specially focuses on the poor pregnant women for States having low institutional delivery rates.
 Each beneficiary registered under this yojana get a Janani Suraksha Yojana Card and Mother Child Protection Card.
 All the pregnant women in Low Performing States are eligible to get the benefit of cash assistance under the Janani Suraksha yojana.
 Whereas in High Performing States only pregnant women belonging to Below Poverty Line, Schedule Caste and Schedule Tribe, aged 19 and above are eligible.
 In High Performing States Below Poverty Line Certificate (BPL) certificate is mandatorily required to avail the benefit.
 If there is no BPL card or have not issued or have not been updated, in that particular cases, Gram Pradhan or Ward Member of that area certify the poor and needy status of pregnant women.
 If a women chooses to deliver her child in accredited private health institutions, it is mandatory to produce a proper BPL or SC/ST certificate to avail the benefit.
 Beneficiary should also carry a referral slip from the ASHA/ANM/MO and the Mother Child Health/ Janani Suraksha Yojana Card.
 Government is not responsible the cost of delivery in accredited private institutions. Beneficiary has to bear the cost and she only get her entitled cash mentioned in the Janani Suraksha Yojana.
 Cash payment is only paid to mother by ANM/ASHA/ Link worker channel at accredited institution.
 No amount of assistance is given to other person or the relative of the pregnant women.
 If there is any complications occur at the time of delivery at accredited institutions, they are fully responsible for any postnatal complication arising out of the cases handled by them. They should not deny their service.
 In case ASHA did not able to organize a transport for the pregnant women to go to the health institution, the amount of transport assistance money in the ASHA's package goes to the pregnant women at the institution, immediately on arrival and registration for delivery.
 Miscellaneous Features
 State/District Authorities would give advance of Rs. 5000/- and Rs. 10,000/- to each ANM in High Performing State and Low Performing State respectively from the Janani Suraksha Yojana Fund.
 The amount of money should be kept in joint account of ANM and Gram Pradhan.
 ANM have full authority to withdraw cash as and when required.
 In case of any complication or a Caesarean Section is needed for delivery, then the assistance up to Rs. 1500/- per delivery is available for hiring specialist from the private sector.
 Janani Suraksha Yojana is not a cash distributing scheme, it is a scheme to provide quality maternity services to the pregnant women.
 If ASHA worker neither organize any Antenatal Care for pregnant women nor she assist her to the health care centre, in that case ASHA worker will not receive any compensation package.

Compensation to Victims of Hit and Run:
Overview of the Scheme
 
 Name of Scheme
 Compensation to Victims of Hit and Run Motor Accident Scheme.
 Launched Date
 1st of April 2022.
 Scheme Type
 Cash Assistance to Motor Vehicle Accident Cases.
 Objective
 
 Financial Assistance in case of death occurred due to Hit and Run accident.
 Financial Assistance in case of grievous hurt/ injury by Hit and Run accident.
 
 Nodal Ministry
 Ministry of Road Transport and Highways.
 Assistance
 
 Rs. 2,00,000/- in case of death of victim.
 Rs. 50,000/- in case of grievous hurt caused to victim.
 
 Subscription
 Subscribe Here to Get Update Regarding Scheme.
 Mode of Apply
 Through Application Form.
 Introduction
 Compensation to Victims of Hit and Run Motor Accident Scheme, 2022 is a monetary assistance scheme of Ministry of Road Transport and Highways.
 It was be launched on 1st Of April 2022.
 The scheme will supersede the Solatium Scheme 1989, which is the previous scheme governed by the Government of India for the payment of compensation to the victims of hit and run motor accident.
 Under Solatium Scheme 1989, the amount of compensation was Rs. 50,000/- for Death of a victim and Rs. 12,500/- in case of grievous hurt in hit and run cases.
 But Now under the Compensation to Victims of Hit and Run Motor Scheme, 2022, Ministry of Road Transport and Highways increased the previous compensation for death to Rs. 2,00,000/- and Rs. 50,000/- for grievous hurt.
 The comparison between old compensation scheme and new compensation scheme are as follows :-
 	 
 Old Amount Of Monetary Assistance
 				Under Solatium Scheme, 1989.
 New Amount Of Monetary Assistance Under
 				Compensation to Victims of Hit and Run
 				Motor Accident Scheme, 2022.
 Death
 Rs. 50,000/-
 Rs. 2,00,000/-
 Grievous Hurt
 Rs. 12,500/-
 Rs. 50,000/-
 
 Not many people are aware about this compensation scheme of Central Government.
 In Section 161 of Motor Vehicle Act, there is a special provision as to compensation in case of hit and run motor accident.
 Recently Supreme Court gave a very hard statement on this Compensation to Victims of Hit an Run Motor Accident Scheme while observing very low turn out of claims under this scheme.
 Supreme Court said that it is the duty of Police Officers to let people aware about this compensation scheme at the time if any accident occurred.
 In case of any accident caused due to Hit and Run, victim or their legal representative can apply for compensation by filling Application Form of Compensation to Victims of Hit and Run Motor Accident Scheme.
 Claim Inquiry Officer will primarily verify the received claim applications and forwarded them to Claim Inquiry Commissioner for the disbursal of financial assistance.
 Benefits of Scheme
 Government of India will provide the following benefits under section 161 of motor vehicle act to victims of hit and run under Compensation to Victims of Hit and Run Motor Accident Scheme :-
 	Financial Assistance will be provided in case of Death and Grievous Injury due to Hit and Run Accident.
 Rs. 2,00,000/- will be provided in case of Death.
 Rs. 50,000/- will be provided in case of Grievous Injury.
 
 Procedure to Claim Compensation
 Applicant have to submit a duly filled Form I to seek Compensation under Central Government's Compensation to Victims of Hit and Run Motor Accident Scheme.
 Form shall be annexed with copy of claim raised by the hospital providing the treatment for cashless treatment payment.
 Undertaking mentioned in Form IV duly attached with application form.
 Any relevant document mentioned in Form I should be annexed with the application Form.
 Duly filled form with the requisite annexures should submitted to the Claim Enquiry Officer of the Sub-Division or Taluka in which the accident took place
 The Claim Enquiry Officer will scrutinised the documents and decide whether the compensation claim is true or not.
 Claim Enquiry Officer submit his report to the Claims Settlement Commissioner, as early as possible.
 If claim found to be right in nature, then within the 15 days of the sanction order, the amount of compensation would be transferred to the beneficiary account.
 Procedure Followed by Claim Enquiry Officer
 Claim Enquiry Officer will accept the Claim Application Form of Compensation to Victims of Hit and Run Motor Accident Scheme.
 Claim Enquiry Officer first Obtain a First Accident Report, and Postmortem report (in case of death) form the concerned authorities.
 If there is more than 1 claimant, Claim Enquiry Officer shall decide the rightful claimant.
 From the date of receipt of the compensation claim application, claim enquiry officer should submit its report to the Claims Settlement Commissioner within the period of one month.
 If Claims Enquiry Commissioner returned the report of Claim Enquiry Officer for additional enquiry, then claim enquiry officer should re-enquire the claim and resubmit its report to the Claims Enquiry Commissioner within a period of 15 days.
 Sanctioning Of Claim
 After receiving the report from Claim Enquiry Officer, Claims Settlement Commissioner has the right to sanction the claim under Compensation to Victims of Hit and Run Motor Accident Scheme.
 It is mandatory for the Claims Settlement Commissioner to sanction the claim as soon as possible but not exceeding the 15 days from the date of receipt of report.
 Claims Settlement Commissioner has right to deduct the amount of claim raised by the hospitals for treatment of the victim.
 If amount claimed by the hospital for treatment is more than that of the fixed compensation amount in the scheme, then in that case no amount will be paid to the claimant or legal representative of the deceased.
 If Claims Settlement Commissioner have doubt on report then he shall return the report to the Claim Enquiry Officer for re-enquiry.
 If the claim found to be rightful then claim settlement commissioner sanction the compensation amount and send his sanction order to General Insurance Council for final disbursal.
 Payment Of Compensation
 The amount of compensation will be transferred in the bank account of beneficiary after the Claim under Compensation to Victims of Hit and Run Motor Accidents Scheme got approved.
 In case of death of victim, the amount of compensation i.e. Rs. 2,00,000/- will be paid to legal representative of the deceased.
 In case of grievous injury, the amount of compensation i.e. Rs. 50,000/- will be paid directly to the injured person.
 General Insurance Council will directly make an E payment to the bank account provided by the claimant or legal representative of the deceased.
 It is mandatory to make payment within the period of 15 days from the date of receipt of order.
 In case the payment is delayed due to any reason, the Claims Settlement Commissioner shall record the reason in writing.
 Key Features of the Scheme
 Compensation amount shall administered from the Motor Vehicle Accident Fund constituted under the section 161 of Motor Vehicle Act.
 Motor Vehicle Accident Fund includes :-
 	Account for Insured Vehicle.
 Account for Uninsured Vehicles.
 
 To monitor, review and administered the scheme there is a Standing Committee at the Centre Level.
 To monitor, to take corrective measures, to evaluate progress of the scheme there is a District Level Committee set up under this scheme.
 It is mandatory to pay the compensation within the 15 days of compensation sanction order.
 Important Forms
 Form I. (Application Form of Compensation From Hit and Run Compensation Fund)
 Form II. (Claim Enquiry report to be submitted by the Claims Enquiry Officer
 Form III. (Order Of the Claims Settlement Commissioner)
 Form IV. (Undertaking For Refund Of Claim)

Overview Of The Scheme
 
 Name Of The Scheme
 SHRESHTA (NETS) Scheme, 2022.
 Full Name Of The Scheme
 Scheme for Residential Education for Students in High Classes in Targeted Areas.
 Scheme Type
 Education Assistance Scheme to Schedule Caste Students.
 Objective
 
 High quality education to Schedule Caste Students.
 Development and Upliftment of Schedule Castes (SCs).
 
 Nodal Agency/Ministry
 National Testing Agency/Department of Social Justice and Empowerment.
 Number Of Seats
 3000 Students per year for Class 9th and Class 11th.
 Introduction
 SHRESHTA is a National Entrance Test conducted by National Testing Agency.
 SHRESHTA refers to Scheme for Residential Education for Students in High Classes in Targeted Areas.
 It is a scheme of Department of Social Justice and Empowerment administered by National Testing Agency.
 It is a 100% central government funded scheme.
 Only Girls and Boys belongs to Schedule Caste are eligible for this scheme.
 Every year 3000 seats are available for the students belongs to Schedule Caste category.
 Selected students gets the admission in Class 9th and Class 11th in a best private residential schools in the country.
 Only online mode are available for apply to this scheme.
 Exams will be conducted in pen and paper mode i.e. Offline mode.
 Medium of question paper is both Hindi and English.
 Bringing SC Certificate at the time of exam is mandatory for all the students.
 Eligibility Conditions
 Only Schedule Castes Students (Girls and Boys) are eligible to apply.
 Students studying in class 8th and 10th.
 Annual income of Parent's should be up to Rs. 2.5 lacs.
 Status of the Scheme for Year 2022-2023
 Online Submission of Application Form
 From 12th March 2022 to 12th April 2022 (upto 05:00 P.M.)
 Date Of Examination
 07 May 2022
 Fees For Application
 No Fee for the Examination.
 Duration Of Exam
 180 Minutes (03:00 Hrs)
 Website
 https://shreshta.nta.nic.in/
 Mode of Apply
 Only Online Mode.
 Mode of Exam
 Only Pen and Paper mode (Offline).
 Negative Marking
 There is no negative marking
 How to Apply
 First go to official website of SHRESHTA.
 Click on Registration for SHRESTHA.
 For new registration click on new Registration.
 An instruction window appears, after successfully reading all the particulars, fill the check box and click on the proceed button.
 Fill all the personal and contact details, then click on submit button after filling the security pin.
 A pop up appears to review the details and edit the details if there is any mistake.
 After reviewing all the details click on yes to submit registration form and wait for the OTP.
 After filling the OTP click on submit registration form. After clicking you are successfully submitted your registration form for SHRESHTA Scheme.
 Then you have to fill an Application form with the below mentioned particulars :-
 	Personal Details.
 Aadhar Details
 Exam and Centre Details
 Qualification Details
 Document Upload
 Final Submit
 
 After submitting all the abovementioned details, an application number is generated for the candidate.
 No provision of editing of application is available after student submitted his/her application form.
 For future reference download the confirmation page/ final submitted application.

Overview Of The Scheme
 
 Name Of Scheme
 Kisan Call Center (KCC).
 Launched on
 21st January, 2004.
 Objective
 
 To solve the issues raised by the farmers on telephone.
 To solve the queries of the farmers in their own native language.
 
 Nodal Agency/Ministry
 Department of Agriculture & Cooperation (DAC).
 Call timing
 6.00 A.M to 10.00 P.M.
 Call Service Provider
 IFFCO Kisan Sanchar Limited (IKSl).
 Introduction
 Kisan Call Centers (KCCs) are established to provide support to farmers.
 Support can be provide through telephonic conversation only.
 In Kisan Call Center farmers can seek assistance on any type of crops related query, some of the queries are as follows:-
 	Disease related query in crops.
 Pest control in crops.
 Plant pathology.
 Soil Science.
 Animal Husbandry.
 Advanced farming practices.
 Organic Farming.
 Information on High Yield Variety Seeds.
 Market Information.
 Support Programmes for Farmers etc.
 
 Farmers seeks assistance by dialing National Toll Free Number 1800 180 1551.
 This number is accessible through all mobile numbers and landlines.
 Calling timings are from 6.00 AM to 10.00 PM on 7 days a week.
 IFFCO Kisan Sanchar Limited (IKSL) is a service provider of Kisan Call Centre.
 At present there are 14 Kisan Call Centres working in 21 different locations serving the needs of farmers in the whole country.
 Features Of Kisan Call Center
 Kisan Call Center are equipped with the state of the art technology, which includes :-
 	Internet Protocol Private Branch Exchange (IPPBX).
 Internet Bandwidth.
 Call Recording/Call Replay.
 Call Barging.
 Voice Mail Service During Call Waiting.
 Voice Mail Service When KCC Is Not Working.
 SMS to Farmers.
 
 Farmer queries can be solved in 22 local languages.
 Queries of the Farmers are addressed by Farm Tele Advisors (FTAs).
 If in case, Farm Tele Advisor is not able to solve the query then the call are transferred to higher level experts.
 Higher level experts are specialist of State Agriculture Departments, ICAR and State Agricultural Universities.
 To facilitate the correct, consistent, quick replies tot he queries and to record all the details of the farmer calls, A Kisan Knowledge Management System has developed.
 Farm Tele Advisor
 Kisan Call Center Agents are known as Farm Tele Advisors.
 They are Graduate, Post Graduate or Doctorate in Agriculture or allied sectors.
 Allied Sectors are :-
 	Horticulture.
 Animal Husbandry.
 Fisheries.
 Poultry.
 Bee-Keeping.
 Sericulture.
 Aquaculture.
 Agriculture Engineering.
 Agriculture Marketing.
 Bio-Technology.
 Home Science.
 
 Farm Tele Advisor has excellent communication skills in the respective language.
 Kisan Call Center Registration
 Farmers get themselves registered through by calling a toll free number 1800-180-1551.
 Registration is done by Kisan Call Center Agent who records the personal details of the farmer in Kisan Knowledge Management System (KKMS).
 Farmer then asked to opt his mode of receiving advice through text message (SMS) or voice message.
 Farmer can also registered themselves through the portal i.e. http://mkisan.gov.in/wbreg.aspx or by visiting nearest Common Service Center (CSC).
 Following details are mandatory for registration:-
 	Name
 Mobile Number
 State
 District
 Block
 
 After pressing "Register Button" a verification code will be sent to the farmer's mobile number and after entering it the registration process is completed
 Farmer can also register themselves by sending SMS on 51969 or 7738299899
 Format of the message are:-
 	"KISAN REG <NAME>, <STATE>, <DISTRICT NAME>, and <BLOCK NAME>"(only first 3 letters of State, District, & Block Names are needed. Commas(,) are necessary)
 After typing the message send it to 51969 or 7738299899.

National Means Cum Merit Scholarship Sc:
Overview of the Scheme
 
 Name of Scheme
 National Means Cum Merit Scholarship Scheme.
 Launched on
 May, 2008.
 Number of Scholarship
 1,00,000.
 Amount of Scholarship
 Rs. 12,000/- per year per student.
 			(Rs. 1,000/- per Month)
 Period of Scholarship
 4 years (From Class 9th to Class 12th).
 Nodal Agency/ Ministry
 Department of School Education & Literacy.
 Subscription
 Subscribe Here to Get Update Regarding Scheme.
 Mode of Apply
 Through National Scholarship Portal.
 Introduction
 National Means Cum Merit Scholarship Scheme is Central Sector Scheme of Department of School Education & Literacy.
 It was launched in the month of May 2008.
 The main objective behind starting this scheme to support students financially so that they can easily complete their basic education.
 This scheme is also known as "Central Sector National Means Cum Merit Scholarship Scheme".
 This Scholarship Scheme is specifically launched for the students who belongs to economically weaker sections.
 Through this scheme, Department of School Education and Literacy targets the primary education of students who studying in Class 9th to Class 12th.
 Monthly Scholarship will be provided to selected students under National Means Cum Merit Scholarship Scheme.
 Scholarship amount of Rs. 1000/- per month will be paid to the selected students.
 This means that every year beneficiary student will get Rs. 12,000/- per year as a scholarship under National Means cum Merit Scholarship Scheme of Central Government.
 Students can utilise this scholarship amount on their school fees or they can purchase stationary items or study material as per their requirement.
 Class 8th Passed Students are eligible to apply for scholarship under this scheme.
 Scholarship under National Means Cum Merit Scholarship Scheme will be provided to students for a maximum period of 4 years i.e. from Class 9th to Class 12th.
 1,00,000/- students every year from all over India will be selected for scholarship.
 Selection of Students for Scholarship under National Means Cum Merit Scholarship will be done purely on merit basis.
 Merit will be made through competitive examination which can be conducted by their respective State/ UT.
 This is DBT Scheme in which scholarship amount will be directly paid in the bank account of student.
 Eligible Students can apply for scholarship under National Means Cum Merit Scholarship by filling Online Application Form which is available on National Scholarship Portal.
 The last to apply for National Means Cum Merit Scholarship Scheme is 31-01-2024.
 Benefits of Scheme
 Students selected for scholarship will get the following benefits under National Means Cum Merit Scholarship Scheme :-
 	Monthly Scholarship will be provided.
 Scholarship of Rs. 1,000/- per Month i.e. Rs. 12,000/- per year will be provided.
 Scholarship will be provided for a period of 4 years i.e. Class 9th to Class 12th.
 
 Eligibility Criteria
 Parents Annual Income of Student should be below Rs. 3,50,000/- per year.
 Students will have to secure minimum 55 % marks in Class 8th Examination.
 Scholarship to Students will be provided from Class 9th to Class 12th.
 For SC and ST Students minimum marks percent required is 50 %.
 Only those students are eligible for scholarship who are studying in :-
 	Government Schools.
 Government Aided Schools.
 Local Body School.
 
 Students studying in Kendriya Vidyalaya and Jawahar Navodaya Vidyalaya are not eligible for scholarship.
 Students studying in private school are also not eligible.
 Documents Required
 The following documents is required at the time of availing the benefit of scholarship under National Means Cum Merit Scholarship Scheme :-
 	Income Certificate.
 Caste Certificate.
 Mobile Number.
 Aadhar Card.
 Bank Account Details.
 
 Selection Procedure
 Every State and Union Territory conducts a separate test at the stage of Class VIII for selection of students for scholarship under National Means Cum Merit Scholarship Scheme.
 Exam consist two test:-
 	Mental Ability Test (MAT).
 		It consist 90 multiple choice questions.
 Questions asked on verbal and non-verbal meta-cognitive abilities.
 The questions in MAT are based on :-
 			Reasoning.
 Critical Thinking.
 Analogy.
 Classification.
 Numerical Series.
 Pattern Perception.
 Hidden Figure etc.
 
 
 Scholastic Aptitude Test.
 		It also consist 90 multiple choice questions.
 Questions are based on subjects covering :-
 			Science.
 Social Studies.
 Mathematics.
 
 
 
 Duration of test is 90 minutes.
 Children with disability given extra time as mandated by the respective State Governments.
 It is mandatory to pass in both the test.
 Cut off is 40% marks aggregate for both the test.
 The cut off for students belongs to Schedule Caste and Schedule Tribe is 32% marks.
 Students qualified in the MAT and SAT then register themselves on National Scholarship Portal.
 Applications subject to verify on the portal.
 After verification final list of eligible candidates uploaded on the National Scholarship Portal.
 Ministry then sanction the fund and releases to SBI for allocation.
 State Bank of India disburse the scholarship amount directly to the bank account of the students under Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT).
 Feature of the Scheme
 The operational time period of the National Means Cum Merit Scholarship Scheme is from 2021-22 to 2025-26, i.e. for the period of 5 years.
 Scholarship under this scheme is only for the students who studying in Government, Government Aided or local body schools.
 The amount of scholarship is increased from Rs. 6,000/- to Rs. 12,000/- on 1st of April 2017.
 Student can avail only one scholarship of any Central Scholarship Scheme.
 Students required to open bank account preferably in SBI or any public sector bank.
 No scholarship shall be awarded for studying abroad for any course under this scheme.
 In case, student leave his/her course of study within 1 month, then no scholarship shall be paid to him/her.
 It is mandatory for the student to join the next class within 3 months after the result of the previous class.
 Scholarship will get discontinue if student take gap for any reason in single academic session.
 Once the scholarship discontinued by the government then it cannot be revived under no circumstances.
 Renewal Criteria of the Scheme
 From Class 9th to Class 10th, student has required to get clearly passed the exam in first attempt.
 Minimum 60% marks in Class 10th is mandatory to secure by the student for renewal of the scheme.
 For Schedule Caste and Schedule Tribe students minimum marks required for renewal is 55%.
 From Class 11th to Class 12th, student must clear the final exams in first attempt.
 If students fulfil these above criteria then the scholarship will renew every year.

Overview Of The Scheme
 
 Name Of The Scheme
 Rail Kaushal Vikas Yojana.
 Launched Year
 2015.
 Duration of Training
 3 Weeks (18 Days).
 Nodal Agency
 Indian Railways.
 Nodal Ministry
 Ministry of Skill Development and Entrepreneurship (MSDE).
 Official Website
 Rail Kaushal Vikas Yojna.
 Mode of Applying
 Only Online Mode is Available. (No offline application is entertained).
 Introduction
 Rail Kaushal Vikas Yojna is a short term training programme of Indian Railways.
 It is a training programme comes under Pradhan Mantri Kaushal Vikas Yojna.
 Pradhan Mantri Kaushal Vikas Yojana is the flagship scheme of Ministry of Skill Development and Entrepreneurship.
 Rail Kaushal Vikas Yojna is a skill development training programme in 16 trades.
 The candidate will be given training for 3 weeks i.e. 18 days in a specific trade choosen by him.
 Free of cost training will be provided to the candidate.
 After successful completion of training, candidate will be provided a training completion certificate.
 Objective
 To train youth in their respective trade of interest.
 Helping the candidate to get an employment.
 Make the candidate self employed.
 Eligibility Conditions
 Candidate should be an Indian Citizen.
 Age of the candidate should be between 18-35 years.
 Candidate should be 10th passed or equivalent from an institution recognized by state/central government.
 Candidate should be medically fit. (Medical Certificate is required).
 Document required
 Class 10th Marksheet.
 Class 10th passing certificate.
 Scanned Photograph and Signature.
 Photo Identity Proof (Aadhar Card, Bank Passbook, Ration Card, Pan Card.)
 Affidavit on Rs. 10/- Non-Judicial Stamp Paper.
 Medical Certificate issued by registered MBBS practitioner.
 How to Apply
 First visit official website of Rail Kaushal Vikas Yojana.
 Click on Apply Here, that appears on home page.
 Click on Sign Up to make a new account on portal.
 Fill all the necessary details :-
 	Full Name.
 Email.
 Mobile Number.
 Date of Birth.
 Aadhar Number.
 Password.
 Confirm Password.
 After clicking on Sign Up, your profile will be created.
 
 Sign In to the profile by using your Email and Password.
 Fill all the necessary required information.
 Upload your scanned photograph and signature.
 Submit the application.
 Shortlisted candidate shall be informed through email and SMS.
 After getting shortlisted candidate have to upload scanned copies of :-
 	10th Marksheet or,
 10th Certificate.
 Photo ID Proof.
 Notarized Affidavit.
 Medical Certificate.
 
 Uploading of Document is necessary.
 Training institute will also verify the documents and then finalize the list of the candidates.
 Selected candidate will be informed about the training dates by email.
 Selection Procedure
 Selection of the candidate is purely merit based.
 Percentage marks of a candidate in Class 10th will be the basis of preparing merit.
 In case of CGPA, percentage marks will be calculated by multiplying CGPA with 9.5.
 After accepting all the application, merit will be prepared and selected candidate called for training.
 Features of the Scheme
 Under Rail Kausal Vikas Yojna there is a 18 day free of cost training programme.
 Candidate can choose to get training in any of the 16 trade available.
 There is 92 training centers of Indian Railways across the country to provide training to candidate.
 The target under this scheme to train 50,000 youth in a period of 3 years.
 After successful completion of training a certificate is provided to candidate.
 Till date 9515 candidates get enrolled under this scheme and 6396 successfully completed their training.
 No stipend will be paid by training institute to the candidate in any circumstances.
 Candidate will have to make their own arrangement for fooding and lodging.
 No type of allowance is to be paid by training institute to any candidate.
 Training will given to candidate only in day time.
 Candidates will be liable to pay if any damage caused by them at the time of training.
 Candidate should be medically fit to undergo training.
 Candidate should mandatorily secure the 55% marks in written and 60% marks in practical to get themselves passed in training.
 75 % of attendance is mandatory for the candidate.
 On the basis of training candidate have no right to claim employment in railways.
 There is no reservation, selection is purely based on merit.
 List of Trade Course Under RAIL KVY
 AC Mechanic.
 Carpenter.
 CNSS (Communication Network & Surveillance System).
 Computer Basics.
 Concreting.
 Electrical.
 Electronics & Instrumentation.
 Fitters.
 Instrument Mechanic (Electrical & Electronics).
 Machinist.
 Refrigeration & AC.
 Technician Mechatronics.
 Track Laying.
 Welding.
 Bar Bending and Basics of IT.
 S & T (Signal and Telecommunication).

Overview Of The Scheme
 
 Name of Scheme
 Swanath Scholarship Scheme.
 Number of Scholarship
 
 1,000 seats for Degree Students.
 1,000 seats for Diploma Students.
 
 Amount of Scholarship
 Rs. 50,000/- per Year.
 Period of Scholarship
 
 Maximum 4 years for Degree Students.
 Maximum 3 years for Diploma Students.
 
 Nodal Agency
 All India Council for Technical Education.
 Nodal Ministry
 Ministry of Education/ Department of Higher Education.
 Subscription
 Subscribe Here to Get Update Regarding Scheme.
 Mode of Apply
 Through Swanath Scholarship Scheme Online Application Form.
 Introduction
 Swanath Scholarship Scheme is 100% centrally funded scheme.
 It is implemented by All India Council for Technical Education.
 This scheme is specially focuses on the education of those students who are orphans, whose parents
 	died due to Covid 19, and wards of martyred Armed Forces and Central Paramilitary Forces(Shaheed).
 The main objective behind starting Swanath Scholarship Scheme is to support financially poor students to complete their higher education.
 Financial Assistance every year will be provided under Swanath Scholarship Scheme to pay college fee, to purchase books, equipment, stationary, or computer.
 Scholarship of Rs. 50,000/- per year will be provided to all eligible and selected students.
 Swanath Scholarship is provided to 2,000 students every year.
 1,000 seats is for Degree Students and 1,000 seat is for Diploma Students.
 The maximum time period of the scholarship is 4 years for Degree Students.
 And the maximum time period of the scholarship is 3 years for Diploma Students.
 Those students are not eligible to avail the benefit of Swanath Scholarship Scheme whose family annual income is more than Rs. 8 Lakh per year.
 Beneficiary Students can apply for scholarship under Swanath Scholarship Scheme through Online Application Form which is available on National Scholarship Portal.
 Students can apply for Scholarship for the year 2023-2024 on or before 31-01-2024.
 31st January 2024 is the last date to apply for Swanath Scholarship Scheme.
 Scholarship is subject to renewal every year.
 Benefits of Scheme
 Central Government will provide the following benefits to selected students under Swanath Scholarship Scheme :-
 	Scholarship of Rs. 50,000/- per Year.
 Scholarship will be Provided Maximum 4 Years for Degree Course and 3 Years for Diploma Course.
 
 Eligibility Criteria
 Swanath Scholarship will only available for below mentioned students :-
 	Orphans.
 Whose One or Both Parents died due to Covid 19.
 Wards of Martyred Armed Forces and Central Paramilitary Forces Personnel.
 
 The Family Income of Student from all sources should not be more than Rs. 8,00,000/- per year.
 Student should be pursuing Degree/ Diploma Level Course in regular mode. (Should be in 1st/ 2nd/ 3rd/ 4th year).
 Student should be studying in AICTE recognised institution.
 Student should not be a beneficiary of any Central/ State/ AICTE approved Scholarship.
 Document Required
 Category of Student
 Documents Mandatorily Needed
 For Orphan Students
 
 Death certificate of Father and Mother (if available) Or
 				Certificate issued by Tehsildar/ SDM as per format.(Annexure - I)
 Bonafide Certificate issued by Institution.
 10th and 12th Marksheet/ Equivalent Course Marksheet for Degree Level Course.
 10th/Equivalent Marksheet for Diploma Level Course.
 SC/ ST/ OBC-NCL Certificate.
 
 For Candidates Whose One or
 			Both Parents Died Due to Covid 19
 
 Death Certificate of Father/ Mother or both, specifically mentioning that the death was due to Covid 19.
 Income Certificate of current year if one parent (Father or Mother) is alive.
 Bonafide Certificate issued by Institution.
 10th and 12th Marksheet/ Equivalent Course Marksheet for Degree Level Course.
 10th/ Equivalent Marksheet for Diploma Level Course.
 SC/ ST/ OBC-NCL Certificate.
 
 For Wards of Martyred Armed Forces and
 			Central Paramilitary Forces personnel (Shaheed).
 
 Death Certificate.
 Shaheed Certificate issued by Armed Forces/ Central Paramilitary Forces.
 Bonafide Certificate issued by the Institutions.
 10th and 12th Marksheet/ Equivalent Course Marksheet for Degree Level Course.
 10th/ Equivalent Marksheet for Diploma Level Course.
 SC/ ST/ OBC-NCL Certificate.
 Income Certificate of Family.
 
 How to Apply
 The only mode to apply for this scheme is through Online Application Form of Swanath Scholarship Scheme.
 Swanath Scholarship Scheme Online Application Form is available on National Scholarship Portal.
 Student have to register themselves first by clicking on New Registration.
 Candidate have to fill required details in the Registration Form of Swanath Scholarship Scheme :-
 	State of Domicile.
 Scholarship category whether pre-matric or post matric.
 Name.
 Scheme Type.
 Date of Birth.
 Gender.
 Mobile Number.
 Email Id.
 Bank IFSC Code.
 Bank Account Number.
 Aadhar Number.
 
 After Filling all the necessary details, click on Register.
 National Scholarship Portal will send the login details on the mobile number and on the email of student.
 With log in credential given by the portal, Log in to submit the Swanath Scholarship Scheme Application.
 Select Swanath Scholarship Scheme, fill all the required details and click on submit the application.
 Application will be scrutinised and selected candidate list will be available on AICTE Portal.
 This scheme is subject to renewal, so candidate have to renew Swanath Scholarship Scheme Application every year.
 National Scholarship Portal is open to apply for Swanath Scholarship Scheme.
 Students can apply for Swanath Scholarship Scheme on or before 31-01-2024.
 The last date to apply for Scholarship under Swanath Scholarship Scheme is 31st of January 2024.
 Selection Procedure
 For Degree Level
 Selection for Swanath Scholarship will be done on the basis of merit of qualifying examination i.e. 12th or equivalent examination.
 In case there is a tie on the basis of qualifying marks, the following procedure will be followed to break ties :-
 	The candidate who has higher marks in 10th will be ranked higher.
 In case 10th marks does not break tie, then the older age candidate will be ranked higher.
 If above mentioned method doe not break ties, then the candidate with lower annual family income will be ranked higher.
 
 For Diploma Level
 Candidate will be selected through merit of qualifying examination to pursue the Diploma course.
 Qualifying examination for Diploma course is Class 10th.
 In case of tie on qualifying marks, the following procedure will be followed to break ties :-
 	Candidate of elder age will be ranked higher.
 If age does not resolve the tie, then the candidate with lower annual family income will be ranked higher.
 
 Features of the Scheme
 Swanath Scholarship Scheme is available only once in a year.
 Aadhar number is mandatory for applying for this scheme.
 No application will be accepted without valid Aadhar Card.
 If candidate drop out the course in between, she/he will not be eligible for further scholarship under Swanath Scholarship Scheme.
 Scholarship is available only for those students who are studying in AICTE recognised institutions.
 The candidate should not be a beneficiary of any Central/ State/ AICTE scholarship.
 Only 2,000 scholarship seats are available for the eligible candidates every year.
 Candidate can avail the benefit of the scheme in any year of their course.
 Scholarship amount will be paid to student to assist them for purchase of computer, stationary, books, equipment, software etc.
 No additional grant for hostel fees or medical fees will be paid under this scheme.
 Mode of selection for Swanath Scholarship Scheme will be purely on merit basis.
 Students studying technical courses and technical diploma are eligible for scholarship.
 List of short listed candidates under Swanath Scholarship Scheme will be available on the AICTE web portal.
 The method for converting CGPA into percentage is by multiplying CGPA with 9.5. (CGPA × 9.5).
 The amount of scholarship directly paid to the candidate in their bank accounts.
 If student fail to promote to the next class, their scholarship will be forfeited.
 It is mandatory to upload promotion certificate of the course at the time of renewal of scholarship application.
 Important Forms
 Swanath Scholarship Scheme Certificate for Orphan Candidate.
 Swanath Scholarship Scheme Bonafide Certificate for Institutions.
 Swanath Scholarship Scheme Family Income Certificate.

Pragati Scholarship Scheme:
Overview Of The Scheme
 
 Name of Scheme
 Pragati Scholarship Scheme
 Number of Scholarship
 
 5,000 Seats for Technical Degree Students.
 5,000 Seats for Technical Diploma Students.
 
 Amount of Scholarship
 Rs. 50,000/- per per year.
 Period of Scholarship
 
 Maximum 4 years for Technical Degree Students.
 Maximum 3 years for Technical Diploma Students.
 
 Eligibility
 Two Girl Students per Family are Eligible.
 Nodal Agency
 All India Council for Technical Education.
 Nodal Ministry
 Ministry of Education.
 Subscription
 Subscribe Here to Get Update Regarding Scheme.
 Mode of Apply
 Through Pragati Scholarship Scheme Online Application Form.
 Introduction
 Indian Government runs lots of scholarship scheme to encourage girl students to complete their basic education and pursue for higher one.
 Pragati Scholarship Scheme is also one of the major educational reform scholarship scheme for girl students.
 All India Council for Technical Education is the implementing agency of this scheme.
 The main objective of starting Pragati Scholarship Scheme is to encourage Girl Students to pursue and complete their higher education without thinking about the financial burden.
 This Scheme is also known by some other name i.e., "Pragati Scholarship Scheme for Girl Students".
 Yearly Financial Assistance as a Scholarship for higher education will be provided to all eligible girl students under Pragati Scholarship Scheme.
 Rs. 50,000/- per year of scholarship will be provided for the expenses of college fees, purchasing of books, computer and other study related items.
 10,000 Girl Students per year will get financial assistance as a yearly scholarship for their education under Pragati Scholarship Scheme.
 5,000 Seats is for Degree Students and 5,000 Seats is for Diploma Students.
 Only those Girls are eligible to avail the benefit of Pragati Scholarship Scheme who are pursuing their higher education in Technical Degree Course or in Technical Diploma Course.
 Technical Degree Course Girl Students will get Scholarship for maximum of 4 years.
 And Technical Diploma Course Girl Students will get Scholarship for maximum of 3 Years.
 Girl Students can apply for yearly scholarship under Pragati Scholarship Scheme by filling Online Application Form which is available on National Scholarship Portal.
 The last date to apply for Pragati Scholarship Scheme is 31-01-2024.
 Girl Students can apply for Pragati Scholarship Scheme on or before 31st of January 2024.
 Benefits
 Girl Students will get the below mentioned financial assistance as yearly scholarship under Pragati Scholarship Scheme of AICTE :-
 	Scholarship of Rs. 50,000/- per Year.
 Scholarship will be Provided Maximum of 3 Years for Technical Diploma Course.
 Scholarship will be Provided Maximum of 4 Years for Technical Degree Course.
 
 Eligibility Conditions
 Only Girl Students are Eligible to Apply.
 Scholarship will be Provided to Two Girls in a Family.
 The Annual Income of Girl Student should not be more than Rs. 8 lakh per year.
 Girl Student taking admission in Technical Degree Course or Technical Diploma Course are Eligible.
 First Year Student or Second Year Student (admitted through lateral entry) are Eligible.
 The Educational Institution of the Girl Student should be recognised by AICTE.
 Girl Student should not be a beneficiary of any of the Central/ State/ AICTE sponsored scholarship.
 Document Required
 List of document to be uploaded at the time of applying :-
 	10th Class Certificate & Marksheet.
 12th Class Certificate (in case of degree level) & Marksheet.
 ITI Certificate (In case of lateral entry for diploma level) & Marksheet.
 Diploma Certificate (In case of lateral entry for degree level) & Marksheet.
 Caste Certificate if candidate belongs to SC/ ST/ OBC.
 Aadhar Card.
 Bonafide/Study Certificate (Appendix-I).
 Annual Income Certificate of Family (Appendix-II).
 Promotion Certificate in case of renewal (Appendix-IV).
 Parents Declaration (Appendix-III).
 
 How to Apply
 Eligible Girl Students can apply for Scholarship under Pragati Scholarship Scheme through Online Application Form.
 Online Application Form of Pragati Scholarship Scheme is available National Scholarship Portal.
 Girl Students has to register themselves first by clicking on New Registration.
 Fill the following details in the Registration Form of Pragati Scholarship Scheme :-
 	State of Domicile.
 Scholarship category whether Pre Matric or Post Matric.
 Name of Girl Student.
 Scheme Type.
 Date of Birth.
 Gender.
 Mobile Number.
 Email Id.
 Bank IFSC Code.
 Bank Account Number.
 Aadhar Number.
 
 After filling all the above mentioned details, click on Register.
 Log in to submit your pragati scholarship scheme application with received ID and Password.
 Select Pragati Scholarship Scheme from scheme list, fill all the details, upload all the documents and click on submit button to submit the application.
 Application Form of Pragati Scholarship Scheme and Documents will be scrutinised by the institution where the girl student is studying and also by the technical education department of the State/ UT where the girl student resides and then the selected girl student list will be available on the AICTE Portal.
 Pragati Scholarship Scheme is subject to renewal, so girl student have to renew their application every year.
 Application for the year 2023-2024 of Pragati Scholarship Scheme is live till 31-01-2024.
 Eligible Girl Students can apply for yearly scholarship under Pragati Scholarship Scheme on or before 31st of January 2024.
 Selection Procedure
 For Technical Degree Level Course
 Selection for Pragati Scholarship will be done on the basis of merit of qualifying examination i.e. 12th or equivalent examination.
 In case there is a tie on the basis of qualifying marks, the following procedure will be followed to break ties :-
 	Girl Student who has higher marks in 10th will be ranked higher.
 In case 10th marks does not break tie, then the older age girl student will be ranked higher.
 
 For Technical Diploma Level Course
 Girl Students will be selected for Pragati Scholarship through merit of qualifying examination to pursue the Technical Diploma Course.
 Qualifying examination for Diploma course is Class 10th.
 In case of tie on qualifying marks, the following procedure will be followed to break ties :-
 	Girl Student of elder age will be ranked higher.
 If age does not resolve the tie, then the girl student with lower annual family income will be ranked higher.
 
 Features of the Scheme
 Pragati Scholarship Scheme is available only once in a year.
 Aadhar number is must to apply for scholarship.
 If girl student drop out the course in between, she will not eligible for further scholarship.
 Scholarship available only for those girl students who are studying in AICTE recognised institutions.
 Girl Student should not be a beneficiary of any Central/ State/ AICTE scholarship.
 10,000 scholarship seats are available for the eligible girls candidates every year.
 Out of 10,000/- seats, 5,000/- is for Technical Degree Course and 5,000/- is for Technical Diploma Course.
 Girl Student can avail the benefit of the scheme only in the first and second year of their course.
 Scholarship amount will be paid to student to assist them for the payment of :-
 	College Fee.
 Stationary.
 Books.
 Equipment.
 Computer Purchase.
 Desktop.
 Software Purchase etc.
 
 No additional grant for hostel fees or medical fees will be paid under Pragati Scholarship Scheme.
 Mode of selection will be purely on merit basis.
 Girls Students studying technical courses and technical diploma are eligible for scholarship
 List of short listed girl students will be available on the AICTE web portal.
 The method for converting CGPA into percentage is by multiplying CGPA with 9.5. (CGPA × 9.5).
 The amount of scholarship directly paid to the candidate in their bank accounts.
 If girl student fail to promote to the next class, their scholarship will be forfeited.
 It is mandatory to upload promotion certificate of the course at the time of renewal of scholarship application.
 No documentary proof need to be attached while availing the benefits of the scheme.
 Reservation provided to candidate is as per Government of India norms.
