Credit Guarantee Scheme for Startups:
Overview of the Scheme
 
 Name of the Scheme
 Credit Guarantee Scheme for Startups
 Launch Year
 2022
 Benefits
 Hassle and Collateral Free Credit or Loans
 Beneficiary
 DPIIT Register Startups
 Nodal Department
 Ministry of Commerce and Industry
 Subscription
 Subscribe here to get Update Regarding Scheme
 Mode of Apply
 
 Applicants may register for DIPP Recognition Online
 Application process for Start-up Credit Guarantee Scheme is offline
 
 Introduction
 After US and China, India stands as the third largest hub for startup globally.
 According to the DPIIT, there are currently 123,073 DPIIT recognised startup operational in India.
 Remarkably, around 48% of these startups are from Tier 2 and Tier 3 cities.
 However, despite the burgeoning startups ecosystem, many start-ups failed to sustained because of the financial crunch.
 Recognising this issue, the government has taken some proactive steps to support the startup body.
 In view to, the government announced the Credit Guarantee Scheme for Startups in 2022.
 Under this scheme, the beneficiary will get a credit guarantee up to specified limit against the loan issued by the Scheduled Banks, NBFCs etc.
 Along with this, they will get a collateral free credit or loan from the institutions.
 For individuals, the maximum guarantee is capped at 10 Cr or the actual credit amount, whichever is less.
 The guarantee offering under the scheme would be transaction based and umbrella based.
 On a single borrower basis, the Transaction Based Guarantee is provided to Member of Institution (As of 2024, there are 31 registered MIs).
 Whereas, Umbrella Based Guarantee offers guarantee to Venture Based Funds (VDF) registered under the AIF Regulation of SEBI.
 Benefits of Scheme
 The foremost benefit of the Credit Guarantee Scheme for Startups (CGSS) is they are offering Credit guarantee against your loan.
 Secondly, beneficiary will get a collateral free credit or loan from the MIs.
 Individual will receive a maximum credit guarantee of Rs 10 Cr or their actual outstanding credit amount, whichever is lower.
 Guarantee offers under the CGSS is transaction based or Umbrella Based.
 Scheme Type
 Default Cover Offered
 Transaction Based Guarantee
 
 80% if Loan amount is 3 Cr.
 75% if the loan amount is above 3 Cr.
 65% if the loan amount is above 5 Cr (up to 10 Cr).
 
 Umbrella Based Guarantee
 Actual loss or 5% of the pooled investment, whichever is lower (maximum 10 Cr per borrower).
 Eligibility Criteria
 To borrow Credit Guarantee under the CGSS have some specific criteria for startups, that are as follows:
 	Startups must be registered and recognised by the DPIIT.
 		For this, the company age or its operation should not exceed 10 years.
 Company must be incorporated as a Private limited or Registered partnership firm or Limited Liability Partnership.
 Since Inception, the Annual turnover of the company should not exceed Rs 100 Cr.
 Innovation and scalability are two prime aspects of the company which may generate wealth and employment.
 Ensure the company should not have any connection to splitting or reconstruction of any existing business.
 
 As per the RBI Guidelines, Startups must not be defaulted by any institution and labelled as Non Performing Asset.
 The Member of Institution certifies the eligibility for guarantee cover of the startup.
 Must have generated a stable revenue over the last 12 months.
 Scheduled bank and NBFCs must have a rating of BBB and above.
 
 Documents Required
 Applicants must submit the documents in support of their Credit Guarantee Scheme for Startups application as required by the Member of Institution.
 	PAN Card
 Company Registration Certificate
 Revenue Details
 Voter ID
 Aadhaar Card
 Passport Size Photograph
 Residence Proof
 Company Address Proof
 DIPP Recognition Certificate
 As required by the Member of Institution.
 
 How to apply
 As the Guarantee is offered by the Registered MIs to eligible startups that are recognised by the DIPP.
 If your startup is not DIPP recognised then you have to recognised it first.
 For that, you have to create an investor account, if you don't have already.
 You can create your investor account by visiting the National Single Window System Website.
 Post Registration, login to the portal with the generated details.
 Thereafter, you can fill the 'Registration as a Startup' Application form with the required details.
 Once your startup get recognition on DIPP, then you can apply for a credit or loan offline from the Member of Institution that are on the NCGTC panel.
